episodes.title: Lev Tahor: The warped sect of Judaism
episodes.description:
Guatemalan authorities are investigating Lev Tahor, an ultra-Orthodox Jewish sect, for a multitude of charges including human trafficking. The fringe sect has left a trail of scandals — including child abuse and forced marriages — in its wake.

episodes.title: Cult expert Rick Alan Ross decodes brainwashing tactics | The InnerView
episodes.description:
Rick Alan Ross is a cult expert who has dedicated his life to researching destructive groups and has been involved in deprogramming their members. He joins The InnerView to give his insight into the coercive persuasion techniques infamous cult leaders like Charles Manson and Adnan Oktar employ and explains why these groups extend beyond mere quirky movements.

(Reuploaded due to technical issues)

00:00 Intro
01:25 What makes a cult a cult?
02:36 His first experience dealing with a cult
03:56 The deprogramming of WACO Davidians
05:27 Is there a formula to identify destructive groups?
07:23 “Cult leaders are psychopaths”
08:25 Keith Raniere and NXIVM
10:52 Is a cult a dangerous group or just a movement?
11:50 Turkish televangelist Adnan Oktar
12:35 Why is sex always front and center when it comes to cults?
14:01 Social isolation and control
15:30 New age brainwashing
18:00 Government response to cult activities
20:15 Groups that are unfairly being labeled as cults
22:00 How can people protect themselves against cults?
25:09 Can a cult or cult leader ever be reformed?

episodes.title: Kenya cult mass graves: Organs of several victims missing
episodes.description:
Investigators have revealed that several corpses found in mass graves linked to a Kenyan cult are missing organs, raising suspicions of organ trafficking.

#KenyaCult

episodes.title: Kenyan cult leader Paul Mackenzie Nthenge appears in court
episodes.description:
In Kenya, the leader of a so-called starvation cult, Paul Mackenzie is appearing in court in the coastal town of Malindi. 

He's accused of mass murder, inciting suicide and child cruelty among other crimes, following the discovery of over 100 bodies in the Shakahola Forest last week. As bodies continue to be found, the case is far from over and now authorities are vowing to crack down on fringe groups. Priyanka Navani reports.

episodes.title: Africa Matters: Kenya cult probe widens
episodes.description:
Kenyan police are continuing their inquiry into the cult-related mass deaths near the coastal city of Malindi. Pastor Paul Mackenzie is accused of encouraging his followers to starve to death to get to heaven faster.

episodes.title: Africa Matters: Kenya Starvation Cult
episodes.description:
This week, we go to Malindi in Kenya which has witnessed one of the worst ever cult-related mass deaths. We also look at how Malawi is rebuilding from Cyclone Freddy. And we make a stop in Cameroon, where local shoes are edging out imported brands.

episodes.title: Death toll in Kenyan starvation cult rises to 89
episodes.description:
Authorities have so far found 89 bodies in southeast Kenya, where a cult leader encouraged followers to starve themselves in order to meet Jesus.

 The fear among Kenyans is that many more graves are yet to be dug up, and that the leader may not face justice. Priyanka Navani reports.

episodes.title: Police probe starvation cult in Kenya after exhuming 73 bodies in forest
episodes.description:
The death toll in a suspected Kenyan starvation cult has now risen to 73. An investigation has uncovered a Christian church whose followers are believed to have starved themselves to death. They believed this would send them to heaven.

The death toll could rise further as 112 people have been reported missing. The cult's leader was arrested following a tip-off. TRT World's Isabella Bull reports.

episodes.title: Kenya Police exhume 21 bodies in forest in probe into starvation cult
episodes.description:
Police in Kenya have exhumed 21 bodies during an investigation into a cult whose followers are believed to have starved themselves to death. At least 58 graves have been identified so far.

TRT World's Isabella Bull reports.

episodes.title: Turkish court sentences cult head Adnan Oktar to 1,075 years in prison
episodes.description:
A Turkish court sentenced cult leader #AdnanOktar, also known as #HarunYahya, to more than 1,000 years in prison for 10 separate crimes. Here's a look at his case.

episodes.title: US-based cult leader Fetullah Gulen’s bizarre gifts
episodes.description:
“I am not worthy of this. What is this grace and goodness towards me?”
This is how Turkish NBA player Enes Kanter responded when US-based cult leader Fetullah Gulen said the tea he took a sip of should be given to Kanter, his loyal follower.
